A.expression: Alla känner apan, men apan känner ingen.
A.translation: Everyone knows the monkey, but the monkey knows no one.
A.meaning: Those that stick out are often both well-known and avoided.

A.expression: Alla sätt är bra utom de dåliga.
A.translation: All methods are good except for the bad ones.

A.expression: Alla är vi barn i början.
A.translation: We all start out as children.
A.meaning: Mistakes should be expected of beginners.

A.expression: Alla vill vara herrar, men ingen vill bära säcken
A.equivalent: There are too many chiefs and not enough indians.

A.expression: Allt är inte guld som glimmar.
A.equivalent: All that glitters is not gold.
The best defense is a good offense.

A.expression: Att skiljas är att dö en smula.
A.translation: To separate is to die a little.

A.expression: Att försvara ett fel är att fela igen.
A.translation: To defend a wrong, is to wrong do anew.

A.expression: Att våga är att tappa fotfästet en stund, att inte våga är att förlora sig själv.
A.translation: To dare is to lose your foothold for a moment, to not dare is to lose yourself.

A.expression: Av barn, fyllon och dårar får man höra sanningen.
A.equivalent: Children, fools and drunken men tell the truth.
A.translation: From children, drunkards and madmen you get to hear the truth.

B.expression: Bara döda fiskar följer strömmen.
B.translation: Only dead fish follow the stream.

B.expression: Barn gör som du gör, inte som du säger.
B.translation: Children do as you do, not as you say.

B.expression: Behandla andra som du själv vill bli behandlad.
B.equivalent: Do unto others as you would have them do unto you.
B.translation: Treat others as you would want to be treated yourself.

B.expression: Blod är tjockare än vatten.
Blott Sverige svenska krusbär har.
Borsta framför din egen dörr först.
Borta bra men hemma bäst.
B.translation: Away is good but home is best.

B.expression: Bra karl reder sig själv.
B.equivalent: Every bird must hatch its own eggs.
B.translation: A good man manages on his own.

B.expression: Bränt barn skyr elden.
Bättre brödlös än rådlös.
B.equivalent: Better short of pence than short of sense.

B.expression: Bättre dåligt minne än dåliga minnen.
B.translation: Poor memory is better than bad memories.
B.meaning: Don’t dwell on past mistakes and bad experiences.

B.expression: Bättre ett ärligt nej än ett falskt ja.
B.translation: Rather an honest ‘no’ than an insincere ‘yes’.
B.meaning: Telling a bitter truth is usually better than lying.

B.expression: Bättre förekomma än förekommas.
B.equivalent: Better give the slight than take it.

B.expression: Bättre en fågel i handen än tio i skogen.
B.equivalent: A bird in the hand is worth two in the bush.
B.translation: Better one bird in the hand than ten in the forest.
B.meaning: Value the things you already have more than the things you might never get.

B.expression: Bättre ensam än i dåligt sällskap.
B.equivalent: Better alone than in bad company.

B.expression: Bättre fly än illa fäkta.
B.equivalent: He who fights and runs away may live to fight another day.
B.translation: Better to flee than to fence poorly.

B.expression: Bättre sent än aldrig.
Bättre stämma i bäcken än i ån.
B.equivalent: An ounce of prevention is worth a pound of cure.
B.translation: Better to dam the brook than the creek.
B.meaning: Be proactive about preventing bad things from happening; defects are best taken care of at an early stage.

B.expression: Bättre tiga än illa tala.
B.equivalent: Man more often repents what he did say than he did not.
B.translation: Better to keep quiet than to speak poorly (of someone).

B.expression: Bättre älskat och förlorat än att aldrig ha älskat.
B.equivalent: Tis better to have loved and lost than to have never loved at all.

B.expression: Bäst att smida medan järnet är varmt.
B.translation: Strike while the iron is hot.

B.expression: Bäst bli klok av annans skada.
B.equivalent: Wise men learn by other men men’s harms, fools by their own.
B.translation: Best to learn from other people’s injury.

D.expression: Delad glädje är dubbel glädje (och delad sorg är halv sorg).
D.equivalent: Joy shared, joy doubled: sorrow shared, sorrow halved.
D.translation: Shared joy is twice the joy (and shared grief is half the grief).

D.expression: Den dagen, den sorgen.
D.equivalent: Cross your bridges when you reach them.
D.translation: That day, that sorrow.

D.expression: Den drucknes tal är den nyktres tankar.
D.translation: The drunken man’s words is the sober man’s thoughts.

D.expression: Den enes död, den andres bröd.
D.equivalent: One man’s meat is another man’s poison.
D.translation: The death of one, the bread of the other.

D.expression: Den som alltid vet bäst lär sig aldrig något.
D.translation: He who always knows best never learns.

D.expression: Den som gapar efter mycket, mister ofta hela stycket.
D.equivalent: Grasp all, lose all.
D.translation: He who bids for much, often loses all.

D.expression: Den som ger sig in i leken, får leken tåla.
D.equivalent: He that would have eggs must endure the cackling of hens.
D.translation: He who enters the game must endure it.

D.expression: Den som gräver en grop åt andra faller ofta själv däri.
D.translation: He who digs a pit for others, often falls into it himself.

D.expression: Den som lever får se.
D.equivalent: Only time will tell.
D.translation: He who lives shall see.

D.expression: Den som sover syndar icke.
D.equivalent: Criticism is something you can avoid by saying nothing, doing nothing and being nothing.
D.translation: He who sleeps does not sin.

D.expression: Den som spar han har.
D.equivalent: Waste not, want not.
D.translation: He who saves, has.

D.expression: Den som tiger han samtycker.
D.translation: He who stays quiet consents.

D.expression: Den som viskar han ljuger.
D.translation: He who whispers lies.

D.expression: Den som väntar på något gott, väntar aldrig för länge.
D.translation: He who waits for something good never waits too long.

D.expression: Den spik som sticker ut blir slagen.
D.translation: The nail that sticks out gets struck.

D.expression: Den som är fri från synd skall kasta första stenen.
D.equivalent: Let him who is without sin cast the first stone.

D.expression: Det angår också dig när det brinner i grannens vägg.
D.translation: It concerns you, too, when your neighbor’s wall is on fire.

D.expression: Det blir aldrig som man tänkt sig.
D.translation: Things never turn out the way you imagined.

D.expression: Det blir som det blir.
D.equivalent: We must take things as we find them.
D.translation: It will be like it will be.

D.expression: Det dunkelt sagda är det dunkelt tänkta.
D.translation: What is unclearly said is unclearly thought.

D.expression: Det finns inget dåligt väder, bara dåliga kläder.
D.equivalent: There’s no such thing as bad weather, only the wrong clothes.

D.expression: Det gäller att smida medan järnet är varmt.
D.equivalent: Strike while the iron is hot.
D.translation: You should forge while the iron is hot.

D.expression: Det kommer inga stekta sparvar flygande i din mun.
D.equivalent: Birds fly not into our mouth ready roasted.
D.translation: No fried sparrows will fly into your mouth.

D.expression: Det man inte har i huvudet får man ha i benen.
D.equivalent: A forgetful head makes a weary pair of heels.
D.translation: What one’s head lacks one has to have in one’s legs.

D.expression: Det man inte vet mår man inte dåligt av.
D.translation: What you do not know does not hurt you.

D.expression: Det man förlorar på gungorna tar man igen på karusellen.
D.equivalent: What you lose on the swings you gain on the roundabouts.
D.translation: What you lose at the swings you take back at the merry-go-round.

D.expression: Det ska böjas i tid det som krokigt ska bli.
D.equivalent: Soon crooks the tree that good gambrel would be.
D.translation: It is to be bent in time, that which bent shall be.

D.expression: Det som börjar med en knappnål slutar oftast med en silverskål
D.equivalent: He that steals an egg will steal an ox.
D.translation: What starts with a needle usually ends with a silver bowl.

D.expression: Det som inte dödar, härdar.
D.equivalent: That which does not kill you, makes you stronger. Pain is gain.
D.translation: What doesn’t kill, hardens.

D.expression: Det som göms i snö kommer fram vid tö.
D.translation: What is hidden in snow is revealed at thaw.

D.expression: Det vattnet du hämtar ur bäcken lär dig känna källan.
D.translation: The water you collect from the stream teaches you about its source.

D.expression: Det viktigaste är inte att vinna, utan att kämpa väl.
D.translation: The most important thing is not to win, but to fight well.

D.expression: Det är aldrig för sent.
D.translation: It is never too late.

D.expression: Det är bäst att bita i det sura äpplet.
D.equivalent: Better hold with the hound, as run with the hare.
D.translation: It is best to bite into the sour apple.

D.expression: Det är inte ens fel när två träter.
D.equivalent: It takes two to make a quarrel.
D.translation: It is not one person’s fault if two people quarrel.

D.expression: Det är lätt att skära breda remsor av andras läder.
D.equivalent: Men cut large thongs of other men’s leather.
D.translation: It is easy to cut broad strips off other people’s leather.
D.meaning: This Proverb aims at all thoſe Perſons, who, niggardly to an Exceſs of their own, would fain gain the Character of Generous or Charitable at other People’s Expences, and ſo are very liberal of other People’s Pockets to ſave their own, either in Donations of Amity or Alms.

D.expression: Det är lätt att vara efterklok.
D.equivalent: It’s easy to be wise after the event.
D.translation: It is easy to be prudent in hindsight.
D.meaning: With hindsight it is easy to see what went wrong or what should have been done, but this is of no practical purpose.

D.expression: Det är mänskligt att fela men gudomligt att förlåta.
D.equivalent: To err is human; to forgive, divine.

D.expression: Det är saligare att giva än att taga.
D.translation: It is more blissful to give than to receive.
D.meaning: The act of giving is more worthy, noble and spiritually satisfying than the act of receiving,

D.expression: Det är skönare lyss till den sträng som brast än att aldrig spänna en båge.
D.translation: It is fairer to listen to the string that broke than to never strain a bow.
D.meaning: It is better to fail than to never have tried.

D.expression: Det är som mörkast innan gryningen.
D.equivalent: It’s always darkest before the dawn.
D.translation: It is darkest before dawn.

D.expression: Det är tanken som räknas.
D.translation: It’s the thought that counts.
D.meaning: Good intentions make up for a bad outcome.

D.expression: Dra inte alla över en kam.
D.translation: Do not pull everyone over with a comb.

D.expression: Dra sitt strå till stacken
D.equivalent: We ourselves feel that what we are doing is just a drop in the ocean. But the ocean would be less because of that missing drop.
D.translation: Carry one’s straw to the hill.
D.meaning: To do one’s share of a work at hand (usually for a good cause).

D.expression: Droppen kan urholka stenen.
D.equivalent: Constant dripping wears the stone.
D.translation: The dripping can hollow the stone.

D.expression: Där vinet går in går vettet ut.
D.translation: Where wine enters sense leaves.

E.equivalent: It’s a long lane that has no turning.
E.translation: After rain comes sunshine.

E.equivalent: Advice comes too late when a thing is done.
E.translation: Afterwards is no advice.

E.equivalent: There is no place like home.
E.translation: Own hearth is gold worth.
Self-praise stinks.
Don’t light a fire for the crows.

E.expression: En dålig hantverkare skyller på sina verktyg.
E.translation: A poor craftsman blames his tools.

E.expression: En gnutta osaklighet sparar tonvis med förklaringar.
E.translation: An ounce of lying saves tons of explanations.

E.expression: En kedja är inte starkare än dess svagaste länk.
E.equivalent: A chain is only as strong as its weakest link.
E.translation: A chain is no stronger than its weakest link.
E.meaning: A weak part or member will affect the success or effectiveness of the whole.

E.expression: En knuten näve kan varken ge eller ta.
E.translation: A clenched fist can neither give nor take.
E.meaning: It is better to make some confession, or pay a little deference to others, our neighbors, friends, acquaintances, and especially our superiors, rather than lose our credit or break friendship.

E.expression: En plats för var sak och var sak på sin plats.
E.translation: A place for each thing and each thing in its place
One time is no time.

E.expression: En gång, ingen gång — två gånger, en vana.
E.translation: One time, no time—two times, a habit.
An accident rarely comes alone.
One swallow does not a summer make.
E.meaning: Do not feel sure or rejoice noticing a favourable sign. The appearance of a single sign of a favourable event is not yet a definite indication of its coming. It may be an unrelated, sporadic appearance.

E.expression: En vandring på tusen mil börjar alltid med ett steg.
E.translation: A journey of a thousand miles always begins with a single step.
Alone is strong.
E.meaning: You can accomplish a lot on your own.

E.expression: Envar är sin egen lyckas smed.
E.equivalent: Every man is the smith of his own fortune.
E.translation: Each person is the forger of his own happiness.
E.meaning: In shaping one’s own fortune one should not rely on the help of others, as they are also concerned mainly about their own matters.

E.translation: A hearty laugh lengthens your life.
A soft answer calms the wrath.

E.expression: Ett rent samvete är bästa huvudkudden.
E.equivalent: A good conscience is a soft pillow; A safe conscience makes a sound sleep.
E.translation: A clean conscience is the best pillow.

F.expression: Finns det hjärterum, finns det stjärterum.
F.translation: If there is room in the heart, there is room for the behind.
F.meaning: Said when an effort is made to accommodate guests.

F.expression: För lata svin är marken alltid frusen.
F.equivalent: Idle people have the least leisure.
F.translation: To lazy pigs the ground is always frozen.
Forbidden fruit always tastes the best.
F.meaning: Things that you must not have or do are always the most desirable.

F.expression: Förbjuden väg är ofta hårt sliten.
F.translation: Forbidden road is often heavily worn.

F.expression: Först till kvarn får först mala.
F.translation: First to the mill will first grind.
F.meaning: Those who arrive or apply earliest are most likely to get what they want from a limited supply of things, such as tickets, discounted goods or refreshments.

G.meaning: (Jokingly) said to imply that the older generation is superior, e.g., when an older person beats a younger one at something.

G.expression: Ge dig inte på berg när det finns småsten.
G.translation: Don’t set about mountains when there are pebbles.

G.expression: Genom sig själv känner man andra.
G.equivalent: A thief thinks everyone around him is a thief.
G.meaning: You presume others are like yourself, including when it comes to bad characteristics.
What you think will be a shortcut often isn’t, since you might get lost. Also used metaphorically.

G.expression: Gräset är alltid grönare på andra sidan (staketet).
G.equivalent: The grass is always greener on the far side of the hill.
G.translation: The grass is always greener on the other side (of the fence).
G.meaning: A different place, situation, job, or lifestyle always seems more attractive or appealing than your own.
It is often best to build up upon the prowess and expertise you already have.

G.expression: Guld blindar många, kärleken blindar alla.
G.translation: Gold blinds many, love blinds all.

G.expression: Gå inte över ån efter vatten.
G.translation: Do not cross the brook for water.
G.meaning: Do not do things in a needlessly laborious or complicated way.

G.expression: Gör inte en höna av en fjäder.
G.equivalent: Don’t make a mountain out of a molehill.
G.translation: Do not make a hen out of a feather.
G.meaning: Do not blow things out of proportion.

G.equivalent: If at first you don’t succeed, try, try again.
G.meaning: If you possess the ability to learn from your mistakes, then failure is literally impossible, because each rejection brings you closer to perfection.

H.expression: Han har varit I Rom men inte sett Påven.
H.equivalent: He was in Rome and did not see the pope.

H.expression: Har man sagt A får man säga B.
H.translation: If you say ‘A’ you have to say ‘B’.
H.meaning: If you say or do one thing, you must be prepared to do or say what logically follows.

H.expression: Har man tagit fan i båten får man ro honom i land.
H.equivalent: Better never begun, as never ended.
No one gets rich quickly if he is honest.
H.translation: Quick wealth makes the man suspicious.

H.expression: Hellre en fågel i handen än tio i skogen.
H.equivalent: A bird in the hand is worth two in the bush.
H.translation: Rather one bird in the hand, than ten in the woods.
H.meaning: Something you have for certain now is of more value than something better you may get, especially if you risk losing what you have in order to get it.

H.expression: Hellre fria en skyldig än fälla en oskyldig.
H.translation: It is better to free someone guilty than to convict someone innocent.

H.expression: Hoppet är det sista som lämnar människan.
H.translation: Hope is the last thing to leave a human being.

H.expression: Hur man än vänder sig har man ändan bak.
H.translation: Whichever way you turn you have your end in the back.
H.meaning: Used to express frustration things seems to go wrong no matter what you do.
If you treat others in a bad way, you are likely to be treated in a bad way yourself.

H.translation: The pillow is the best adviser.

H.meaning: Those who are healthy do not appreciate it.

I.expression: I de blindas rike är den enögde kung.
I.equivalent: Among the blind, the one-eyed is king.
I.translation: In the realm of the blind, the one-eyed man is king.

I.expression: I de lugnaste vattnen går de fulaste fiskarna.
I.equivalent: An honest look covereth many faults.
I.translation: In the calmest waters swim the ugliest fish.
I.meaning: An innocent demeanor may hide much guilt.

I.expression: I krig och kärlek är allt tillåtet.
I.equivalent: All is fair in love and war.

I.expression: I mörker är alla katter grå.
I.equivalent: In the dark all cats are gray.
A friend in need is a friend indeed.

I.translation: The truth comes forward in wine.
I.meaning: Alcohol consumed removes the inhibition against telling the truth that occasionally one would like to keep secret.

I.translation: In the desert sand is cheap.

I.expression: Ibland kan man inte se skogen på grund av alla träd.
I.equivalent: He is missing the forest because of the trees.
Too much of one thing, good for nothing
I.meaning: You can have too much of something good.

I.equivalent: All that is fair must fade.
I.translation: No trees grow to the sky.

I.expression: Ingen är profet i sitt eget land/i sin egen hemstad.
I.equivalent: A prophet is not honoured in his own country.
I.translation: No one is a prophet in one’s own homeland/home city.
I.meaning: An outstanding person is often less respected at home than elsewhere. This may be due to personal reasons unrelated to his achievments, or the result of being in an indifferent/ignorant/hostile community.

I.translation: Nothing is new under the sun.
I.meaning: Someone has always done the same thing earlier.

I.expression: Inget ont som inte har något gott med sig.
I.equivalent: No cloud without a silver lining.
I.translation: No bad thing that doesn’t bring something good.

I.expression: Inget är så bra att det inte kan göras bättre.
I.translation: Nothing is so good that it can’t be made better.

J.expression: Ju fler kockar desto sämre soppa.
J.equivalent: Too many cooks spoil the broth.
J.translation: The more chefs, the worse the soup.

J.expression: Ju närmare källan, desto klarare vatten.
J.translation: The closer to the source, the clearer the water.

J.expression: Ju senare på kvällen, desto vackrare folk.
J.translation: The later in the evening, the more beautiful the people.

K.meaning: Every man loves well what is like to himself.

K.equivalent: Do not throw pearls before swine.

K.expression: Kasta inte ut barnet med badvattnet.
K.equivalent: Do not throw the baby out with the bathwater.
K.meaning: Do not reject something in its entirety just because parts of it are bad; other parts might be good.

K.expression: Klaga inte över för lite vind - lär dig segla.
K.translation: Don’t complain about lack of wind—learn to sail.
A beloved child has many names.
K.meaning: Someone or something which is popular is often referred to by many different epithets.

K.equivalent: Let the buyer have a thousand eyes for the seller wants only one.
K.translation: Don’t buy the pig in the bag.

L.meaning: Said when something cannot be undone or taken back.

L.expression: Lat skräddare tar en lång tråd.
L.translation: A lazy tailorer uses a long thread.

L.expression: Lita inte till en annan, det du själv kan göra.
L.equivalent: For what thou canst do thyself, rely not on another.
L.translation: Don’t trust for others, what you can do yourself.

L.expression: Liten tuva stjälper ofta stort lass.
L.translation: A small tuft often overturns a big load.

L.expression: Lyckan kan inte köpas för pengar.

L.equivalent: The wheel of fortune is forever in motion.
L.meaning: People’s fortunes are constantly changing—somebody who has good luck one year may have bad luck the next, and vice versa.
Those who act boldly or courageously are most likely to succeed.

L.expression: Lägg inte alla ägg i samma korg.
L.equivalent: Don’t put all the eggs in the same basket.
L.translation: All eggs should not be put in one basket,
L.meaning: Spread your risks or investments so that if one enterprise fails you will not lose everything.

L.equivalent: Don’t add fuel to the fire.
L.translation: Don’t put stones on a burden.
L.meaning: One should not make a bad situation even worse by an improper remark.

L.expression: Lärdom är mer värt än guld.
L.translation: Insight is more valuable than gold.

L.expression: Lättare döljer en vis sin visdom än en dåre sin dårskap.
L.translation: Easier hides a wise man his wisdom than a fool his madness.

L.meaning: It is usually far easier to advice, suggest, or talk about doing something than actually to do it.

L.expression: Låt inte gräset gro under fötterna.
L.translation: Don’t let grass grow on your feet.

L.equivalent: A nice wife and a back door oft do make a rich man poor.
L.meaning: This Proverb reflects upon the ill Conduct of Men in the Management of their Affairs, by intrufting either Sharpers with their Money, Blabs with their Secrets, or Enemies or Informer: with their Lives: For no Obligation can bind againft Nature: A Fox will love a Goofe ftill, though his Skin be ftript over his Ears for it; and a Common Cheat will always follow his old Trade of tricking his Friend, in fpite of all Promifes and Principle: of Honour, Honefty, and good Faith.

L.translation: Let the food silence the mouth.
L.meaning: Said when someone is being inappropriately loud at the dinner table—often to children.

L.expression: Lögnaren blir bara trodd en gång.
L.translation: The liar will only be trusted once.
L.meaning: Liars must remember the untruths they have told, to avoid contradicting themselves at some later date.

M.expression: Man måste lära sig krypa innan man kan gå.
M.equivalent: Learn to walk before you can run.
M.translation: You must learn to crawl before you can walk.
M.meaning: It is necessary to learn the basics before progressing to more advanced things.

M.expression: Magen mättas förr än ögat.
M.equivalent: The eye is bigger than the belly.
M.translation: The stomach gets full before the eye.

M.expression: Man får ta saken i egna händer.
M.translation: One must take matters into one’s own hands.
M.meaning: If something is bugging you, take care of the problem yourself.

M.expression: Man får ta seden dit man kommer.
M.equivalent: When in Rome, do as the Romans; When among wolves you must howl.
M.translation: Take the custom where you come.

M.expression: Man har aldrig roligare än vad man gör sig.
M.translation: You never have more fun than what you do.
M.meaning: How much fun you have depends on what you choose to do.

M.expression: Man hör vad man vill höra.
M.equivalent: None is as deaf as he who does not want to hear.
M.translation: You hear what you want to hear.

M.expression: Man lär så länge man lever.
M.translation: One learns as long as one lives.

M.expression: Man lär sig av misstagen.
M.translation: One learns from mistakes.

M.expression: Man kan inte både äta kakan och ha kakan kvar.
M.equivalent: You can’t have your cake and eat it too.
M.translation: One cannot both eat one’s cookie and keep it.
M.meaning: You cannot do two mutually incompatible things at the same time.

M.expression: Man kan inte lära gamla hundar sitta.
M.equivalent: You can’t teach an old dog new tricks.
M.translation: You can’t teach old dogs to sit.
M.meaning: Old people are often unwilling or unable to learn new skills or adopt new methods.

M.expression: Man måste rätta munnen efter matsäcken.
M.equivalent: Cut your cloak according to your cloth.
M.translation: You have to correct your mouth according to your lunch pack.
M.meaning: You have to match your revenues with your expenses.

M.expression: Man saknar inte kon förrän båset är tomt.
M.equivalent: You never miss the well till it runs dry.
M.translation: You don’t miss the cow until the stall is empty.
M.meaning: We tend to take some things for granted, and become aware of their value only when they are no longer available.

M.expression: Man ska inte bjuda bagarbarn på bullar.
M.translation: One should not offer cinnamon rolls to baker’s children.

M.expression: Man skall inte byta häst mitt i strömmen.
M.equivalent: Don’t change horses in midstream.
M.translation: One should not change horses in the middle of the stream.
M.meaning: It is often wise not to quit an undertaking already begun.

M.expression: Man ska inte buga för dumheten bara för att den är gammal.
M.equivalent: Might is not always right.
M.translation: One should not bow before stupidity merely because it is old.
M.meaning: Authorities, old customs and old institutions might be in the wrong.

M.expression: Man ska inte döma hunden efter håren.
M.equivalent: Never judge a book by its cover; Never judge by appearances.
M.translation: You should not judge a dog by its fur.
M.meaning: Do not make a judgment about something or somebody on the basis of outward appearance alone.

M.expression: Man ska inte gjuta olja på elden.
M.equivalent: Don’t add fuel to the fire.
M.translation: One should not add oil to the fire.
M.meaning: One should not make a bad situation even worse by an improper remark.

M.expression: Man ska inte gråta över spilld mjölk.
M.translation: Do not weep over spilled milk.
M.meaning: Dwelling on past mishaps will only waste your time.

M.expression: Man tröttnar aldrig på att arbeta för sig själv.
M.equivalent: A man does not feel a burden of his own choosing.
M.translation: You never get tired of working for yourself.

M.expression: Man är alltid sig själv närmast.
M.equivalent: Skin is nearer than the skirt.
M.translation: You are always closest to yourself.
M.meaning: When you make decisions you choose which is best for yourself rather than taking into consideration ethical or ideological convictions.

M.expression: Medan gräset gror, dör kon.
M.equivalent: While the grass grows the steed starves.

M.expression: Mister du en så står dig tusen åter.
M.equivalent: There are plenty of fish in the sea.
M.translation: If you lose one, there are a thousand more to choose from.
M.meaning: Usually used concerning broken hearts. There is also a continuation for it: Väljer du en så är det tusen som gråter. (If you choose one, a thousand will cry.).

M.expression: Morgonstund har guld i mund.
M.equivalent: The early bird catches the worm.
M.translation: Morning hour has gold in its mouth.

M.expression: Mycket vill ha mer.
M.equivalent: Much would have more.
M.translation: Much wants more.
M.meaning: When you have much of something, you will want even more.

M.expression: Måla inte fan på väggen.
M.equivalent: Don’t paint the devil on the wall.

M.expression: Många bäckar små, blir till en stor å.
M.equivalent: Small streams make great rivers.

M.expression: Många hugg fälla eken.
M.equivalent: Many strokes cut down great oaks.
M.meaning: A difficult task, e. g. removing a person/group from a strong position, or changing established ideas cannot be done quickly. It can be achieved gradually, by small steps, a little at a time.

M.expression: Människan spår, men gud rår.
M.equivalent: Man proposes, God disposes.

N.meaning: We should never use an old tool when the extra labor in consequence costs more than a new one. Thousands wear out their lives and waste their time merely by the use of dull and unsuitable instruments.

N.expression: När det regnar manna från himlen har den fattige ingen sked.
N.translation: When it rains manna from heaven, the poor one does not have a spoon.

N.expression: När det regnar på prästen, så droppar det på klockaren.
N.translation: When it rains on the priest, it dripples on the sacristan.
N.meaning: When someone is successful, his subordinates are a little better off as well.

N.expression: När fan blir gammal blir han religiös.
N.translation: When the devil grows old he turns religious.
N.meaning: People often become more religious as they get closer to death. Also used metaphorically when people appear to change in self-serving ways.

N.expression: När Gud kommer med döden, kommer fan med arvingarna.
N.translation: When God brings death, the devil brings heirs.

N.expression: När man talar om trollen så står de i farstun och lyssnar.
N.translation: When you’re speaking about the trolls, they’re standing in the entrance hall listening.

N.expression: När musen är mätt, smakar mjölet beskt.
N.translation: When the mouse is full, the flour tastes bitter.
N.meaning: When you finally got something, you don’t appreciate it anymore.

N.expression: När nöden är som störst är hjälpen som närmast.
N.translation: When distress is the greatest, help is the nearest.

N.expression: När katten är borta dansar råttorna på bordet.
N.equivalent: When the cat’s away, the mice will play.
N.translation: When the cat is away, the rats dance on the table.
N.meaning: In the absence of the person in authority those under his control will often neglect the duties/rules imposed on them.

N.translation: Close does not shoot any hares.

N.meaning: It is acceptable to break rules in times of need.

N.equivalent: Necessity is the mother of invention.

O.expression: Om en blind leder en blind, så faller de båda i gropen.
O.equivalent: If a blind leads a blind man both shall fall into a ditch.
O.translation: If a blind one leads another, they both fall together.
O.meaning: A person ignorant or inexperienced in something cannot assist someone similar.

O.expression: Om kvällen får den late brått.
O.translation: During the evening the lazy get in a hurry.

O.expression: Om man ger någon ett finger vill han ha hela handen.
O.equivalent: Give him an inch and he will take a yard.
O.translation: If you give someone a finger he wants the whole hand.
O.meaning: People are inclined to take excessive advantage of the tolerance or generosity of others; often used to warn against making even the smallest concession.

O.expression: Ont krut förgås inte så lätt.
O.translation: Evil gun powder doesn’t go away easily.

O.equivalent: Fight fire with fire; Like cures like.
O.translation: Evil shall by evil be expelled.

O.equivalent: Be quick to act, and slow to promise.
O.meaning: Avoid making promises (to yourself as well).
Said when it is felt that someone hasn’t received the praise or compensation he deserves.

P.meaning: Money has a value regardless of how it is earned.

P.translation: Money does not grow on trees.

P.expression: Pengar öppnar alla portar utom himmelens.
P.translation: Money opens all gates but heaven’s.

P.expression: Prisa inte dagen fören solen har gått ner.
P.translation: Don’t praise the day before the sun has set.
P.meaning: Dont celebrate until you are 100% sure there is a reason to.

P.expression: På rullande sten växer ingen mossa.
P.translation: A rolling stone gathers no moss.
P.meaning: The unsettled person does not prosper.

P.expression: Politiker är som krokodiler, stora i käften men saknar öron.
P.translation: Politicians are like crocodiles—big jaws but no ears.

R.expression: Rom byggdes inte på en dag.
R.translation: Rome was not built in one day.
R.meaning: Large undertakings need proper time to complete, they cannot be done quickly.

R.expression: Ropa inte hej förrän du är över bäcken.
R.translation: Don’t celebrate until you have crossed the creek.
R.meaning: Don’t cap a victory in advance, and don’t announce something officially which you are not entirely sure of.

S.translation: Sin punishes itself.
S.meaning: Said when someone gets in trouble due to having acted in a bad way.

S.expression: Sagt ord och kastad sten kan inte tas tillbaka.
S.equivalent: A spoken word and a thrown stone cannot be called back.
S.meaning: You can’t take back what you have said.

S.equivalent: Slow and steady wins the race.
S.translation: Slow but steady.
(Too) late shall the sinner awaken.

S.equivalent: If you want something done, do it yourself.
S.translation: Self is the best farmhand.
Shame on he who gives up.

S.expression: Skadeglädjen är den enda sanna glädjen.
S.translation: Schadenfreude is the only true joy.

S.equivalent: Never judge by appearances; Judge not a man and things at first sight.
S.translation: Appearances deceive.
S.meaning: Things are not always as they seem, and you can not necessarily trust the evidence of your eyes.

S.expression: Skjut inte dig själv i foten.
S.translation: Don’t shoot yourself in the foot.

S.expression: Skjut inte upp till morgondagen det du kan göra idag.
S.equivalent: Don’t postpone till tomorrow what you can do today.
A blind man should not judge of colours.
S.translation: Cobbler, stick to your last.

S.equivalent: He who laughs last, laughs longest.
S.translation: He laughs best who laughs last.
Hurry slowly.
S.meaning: Do your work slowly to make sure it gets done thoroughly.

S.expression: Skåda inte given häst i mun.
S.equivalent: Look not a horse in the mouth.
S.translation: Don’t look a gift horse in the mouth.
S.meaning: And so with respect to gifts and donations in general, whether their value be more or less, they should be accounted tokens of kindness and received with promptness and cordiality.

S.equivalent: All is well that ends well.
S.translation: The end is good, everything is good.

S.equivalent: If you buy quality you only cry once.
S.translation: If it tastes good it is expensive.
S.meaning: You get what you pay for.

S.equivalent: There is no accounting for taste.
S.translation: Taste is like the buttocks, divided.
S.meaning: Taste is subjective.

S.expression: Smedens häst och skomakarens ungar är sämst skodda.
S.equivalent: Cobblers’ children are worst shod.
S.translation: The smith’s horse and the shoemakers children are worst shod.
S.meaning: Working hard for others one may neglect one’s own needs or the needs of those closest to him.

S.expression: Små sår och fattiga vänner ska man inte förakta.
S.translation: Small wounds and poor friends should not be despised.

S.equivalent: If you buy cheaply you pay dearly.
S.translation: Stinginess deceives wisdom.

S.expression: Som de gamla sjunga, så kvittra de unga.
S.translation: As old people sing, young people tweet.
S.meaning: Young people grow up to be like old people.

S.equivalent: The devil can cite scripture for his purpose. (From Shakespeare, Merchant in Venice act 1, scene 3)
S.translation: The way the devil reads the bible.

S.expression: Som man bäddar får man ligga.
S.equivalent: As you make your bed, so you must lie.
S.translation: As you make your bed, so will you sleep (or the way you make your bed is the way you will lie).

S.expression: Som man ropar får man svar.
S.translation: As you shout you get will be answered. (As you shout in the forest you will be answered.)
S.meaning: General: The way you formulate a question or a statement will affect the answer you get. Also: your own behavior affects other people’s behavior towards you, e.g., You will be treated politely to the same extent that you yourself act politely.

S.expression: Som man sår får man skörda.
S.equivalent: As you sow, so shall you reap.
S.meaning: The consequences are directly related to one’s actions.

S.expression: Som man är klädd blir man hädd.
S.equivalent: Fine feathers make fine birds.
S.translation: As one is dressed one will be judged.
S.meaning: By dressing in elegant or good-quality clothing, people create a favorable impression on others, often appearing to be of better breeding or higher class than they are

S.translation: Some people are punished immediately by God.
S.meaning: Used sarcastically when something bad—and possibly unrelated—happens to someone just after they have acted in a bad way.

S.equivalent: A sleepy master makes his servant a lout.
S.translation: Sleeping farmer gets a dreaming farmhand.

S.expression: Spill inte krut på döda kråkor.
S.equivalent: Don’t beat a dead horse.
S.translation: Don’t waste gunpowder on dead crows.

S.equivalent: Strive not against the stream.

S.expression: Stor i orden, liten på jorden.
S.equivalent: The worst wheel makes the most noise.
S.translation: Big in the words, small on the ground.
S.meaning: Said about braggarts that have little to show for themselves.

S.equivalent: Sour grapes.
S.translation: ‘Sour’ said the fox about rowanberries.
S.meaning: From a story about a fox that wants to eat some rowanberries that he can’t reach because they’re high up in a tree. A crow lands in the tree and starts eating the berries. When the crow asks the fox if he wants some, the fox replies No, they’re sour. The proverb can be used to state that you think someone really wants something the person claims they do not or that the person makes up an excuse for not wanting it because they cannot get it anyway.

S.expression: Svårigheter finns till för att övervinnas.
S.translation: Adversity exists to be overcome.

S.expression: Så länge det finns liv finns det hopp.
S.translation: While there is life there is hope.
S.meaning: No matter how grave the situation is, there is always a chance that everything will work out.

S.equivalent: Like master, like man.
S.translation: Like master like farm hand/slave/dog.
S.meaning: Servants and other workers tend to follow the good or bad example set by their employers.

S.equivalent: Like mother, like daughter.
S.translation: Such mother, such daughter.
S.meaning: Daughters may look and behave like their mothers. This is due to inheritance and the example observed closely and daily.

S.equivalent: Like father, like son.
S.translation: Such father, such son.
S.meaning: Sons may look and behave like their fathers. This is due to inheritance and the example observed closely and daily.

S.expression: Såga inte av den gren du sitter på.
S.translation: Don’t saw off the branch you’re sitting on.

S.expression: Sälj inte skinnet förrän björnen är skjuten.
S.equivalent: Sell not the bear’s skin before you have caught him.
S.translation: Don’t sell the fur until the bear has been shot.
S.meaning: Do not plan too far ahead and do not be too optimistic. One cannot be sure of the success of a job until it is completed. Unforeseen unfavourable developments can never be excluded.

S.equivalent: Seek and ye shall find.
S.meaning: You must make a personal effort to get what you want.

T.translation: Grab the bull by its horns.
T.meaning: To directly tackle a difficult problem.

T.expression: Tala är silver, tiga är guld.
T.translation: To speak is silver, to keep silent is gold.

T.expression: Tala med bönder på bönders vis och med de lärde på latin.
T.translation: Speak with farmers like farmers speak, and with the educated in latin.
T.meaning: Adjust your message after the receivers ability to understand what you are saying

T.expression: Tiden går fort när man har roligt.
T.translation: Time passes by quickly when you are enjoying yourself.

T.equivalent: It’s the empty can that makes the most noise.
T.meaning: It is not he who advertises for himself the most that can achieve the greatest results.

T.equivalent: God is with those who persevere; Persevere and never fear.

T.meaning: Nothing is impossible to those who have sufficient faith; applied not only to religious faith, but to any strong belief in a cause or objective.

T.expression: Två fel gör inte ett rätt.
T.equivalent: Two wrongs do not make a right.
T.meaning: Wrongdoing is always unacceptable, even if another person has done the same thing.

T.translation: Patience is the art of hoping.

U.meaning: The existence of an exception to a rule shows that the rule itself exists and is applicable in other cases; often used loosely to explain away any such inconsistency.

V.expression: Var dag har nog av sin egen plåga.
V.equivalent: Sufficient untill the day is the evil thereof.
V.translation: Each day has enough of its own misery.

V.expression: Var fågel sjunger efter sin egen näbb.
V.translation: Each bird sings according to its own beak.

V.expression: Var skall sleven vara om inte i grytan?
V.equivalent: Let him that is cold blow the coals.
V.translation: Where shall the ladle be if not in the cauldron?

V.meaning: Each household has its own customs.

V.expression: Varav hjärtat är fullt talar munnen.
V.equivalent: The tongue ever turns to the aching tooth; What the heart thinketh the tongue speaketh.
V.translation: Of what fills the heart speaks the mouth.
Every cloud has a silver lining.
V.meaning: Bad situations often bring something good with them.
Things that happen in real life are often far more unlikely than those dreamed up by writers.

V.expression: Vill man vara fin får man lida pin.
V.equivalent: No pain, no gain; Nothing ventured, nothing gained.

V.expression: Vis är den som råd lyder, men oråd skall ingen lyda.
V.translation: Those are wise that heed advice, but no one should heed dissuasive advice.
V.meaning: Advice often contain a genuine warning or an effective suggestion, which is unprudent not to take into consideration.

V.expression: Visdomen har långa öron och kort tunga.
V.equivalent: Nature gave us two ears and one mouth.
V.translation: Wisdom has long ears and short tongue.

V.expression: Väck inte den björn som sover.
V.translation: Do not wake the bear that sleeps.
V.meaning: Do not cause trouble by disturbing a stable—but potentially problematic—situation.

V.expression: Vännens örfil är ärligt menad, fiendens kyssar vill bedra.
V.equivalent: A friend’s frown is better than a foe’s smile.
V.translation: A friend’s slap has honest intentions, your enemies’ kisses are meant to deceive.

V.expression: Vägen till helvetet är kantad med goda föresatser.
V.equivalent: The road to hell is paved with good intentions.

V.expression: Vägen till mannens hjärta går genom magen.
V.equivalent: The way to a man’s heart is through his stomach.
V.meaning: The best way to please a man is by feeding him well.
Someone you are talking about will often overhear your conversation.

It is amazing how often you meet somebody you know—or somebody who knows one of your friends or relatives, comes from your home town, or went to your school—in a distant or unexpected place; said when such a coincidence occurs.

Å.expression: Åsnan känns igen på öronen, den dumme på sina ord.
Å.translation: The donkey is known by his ears, the fool by his words.

Ä.expression: Älska mig när jag minst av allt förtjänar det, för det är då jag behöver det som mest.
Ä.translation: Love me when I least deserve it, because that is when I need it the most.

Ä.meaning: Any course of action, however immoral or unscrupulous, is justifiable if it achieves a worthy objective.

Ä.expression: Äpplet faller inte långt från trädet.
Ä.translation: The apple does not fall far from the tree.
Ä.meaning: Children observe daily and—in their behaviour—often follow the example of their parents.

Ä.expression: Är det inte det ena så är det det andra, sa flickan som blödde näsblod.
Ä.translation: ‘If it isn’t one thing it’s the other’ said the girl with a nosebleed.
Ä.meaning: There is always something to be dissatisfied with.

Ä.expression: Är huvudet dumt får kroppen lida.
Ä.translation: If the head is dumb, the body suffers.
Ä.meaning: Said when someone hurts him or herself through a foolish act.
Being honest or telling the truth is always the wisest course of action.

Ä.equivalent: Give credit where credit is due.

Ä.expression: Äta bör man annars dör man.
Ä.translation: One should eat or one dies.
Even the best can make mistakes.

Ä.expression: Även dåren tros vis om han tiger.
Ä.equivalent: Even a fool when he holdeth his peace is counted wise.

Ä.expression: Även en blind höna kan hitta ett korn.
Ä.equivalent: Even a blind pig may occasionally pick up an acorn.
Ä.translation: Even a blind hen can find a grain.
Ä.meaning: An incompetent person or an unsystematic approach is bound to succeed every now and then by chance.
Children often understand more than one might think.

Ä.translation: The sun also has its spots.

Ö.expression: Öga för öga, tand för tand.
Ö.equivalent: Eye for an eye, tooth for a tooth.
Ö.meaning: Retaliation or punishment should take the same form as the original offense or crime.

Ö.expression: Ögonen vill ha mer än magen.
Ö.equivalent: The eye is bigger than the belly.
Ö.translation: The eyes want more than the stomach.
Ö.meaning: Greed persuades a person to take more the he or she can manage.
